verses.verse: <S%H2896>Better<s%> is the <S%H7326>poor<s%> that <S%H1980>walketh<s%> in his <S%H8537>integrity<s%>, than he that is <S%H6141>perverse<s%> in his <S%H8193>lips<s%>, and is a <S%H3684>fool<s%>.
Also, that the <S%H5315>soul<s%> be without <S%H1847>knowledge<s%>, it is not <S%H2896>good<s%>; and he that <S%H213>hasteth<s%> with his <S%H7272>feet<s%> <S%H2398>sinneth<s%>.
The <S%H200>foolishness<s%> of <S%H120>man<s%> <S%H5557>perverteth<s%> his <S%H1870>way<s%>: and his <S%H3820>heart<s%> <S%H2196>fretteth<s%> against the <S%H3068>LORD<s%>.
<S%H1952>Wealth<s%> <S%H3254>maketh<s%> <S%H7227>many<s%> <S%H7453>friends<s%>; but the <S%H1800>poor<s%> is <S%H6504>separated<s%> from his <S%H7453>neighbour<s%>.
A <S%H8267>false<s%> <S%H5707>witness<s%> shall not be <S%H5352>unpunished<s%>, and he that <S%H6315>speaketh<s%> <S%H3577>lies<s%> shall not <S%H4422>escape<s%>. unpunished: Heb. held innocent

<S%H7227>Many<s%> will <S%H2470>intreat<s%> the <S%H6440>favour<s%> of the <S%H5081>prince<s%>: and every man is a <S%H7453>friend<s%> to <S%H376>him<s%> that giveth <S%H4976>gifts<s%>. him: Heb. a man of gifts

All the <S%H251>brethren<s%> of the <S%H7326>poor<s%> do <S%H8130>hate<s%> him: how much more do his <S%H4828>friends<s%> go <S%H7368>far<s%> from him? he <S%H7291>pursueth<s%> them with <S%H561>words<s%>, yet they are wanting to him.

He that <S%H7069>getteth<s%> <S%H3820>wisdom<s%> <S%H157>loveth<s%> his own <S%H5315>soul<s%>: he that <S%H8104>keepeth<s%> <S%H8394>understanding<s%> shall <S%H4672>find<s%> <S%H2896>good<s%>. wisdom: Heb. an heart
A <S%H8267>false<s%> <S%H5707>witness<s%> shall not be <S%H5352>unpunished<s%>, and he that <S%H6315>speaketh<s%> <S%H3577>lies<s%> shall <S%H6>perish<s%>.
<S%H8588>Delight<s%> is not <S%H5000>seemly<s%> for a <S%H3684>fool<s%>; much less for a <S%H5650>servant<s%> to have <S%H4910>rule<s%> over <S%H8269>princes<s%>.

The <S%H7922>discretion<s%> of a <S%H120>man<s%> <S%H748>deferreth<s%> his <S%H639>anger<s%>; and it is his <S%H8597>glory<s%> to pass <S%H5674>over<s%> a <S%H6588>transgression<s%>. discretion: or, prudence
The <S%H4428>king's<s%> <S%H2197>wrath<s%> is as the <S%H5099>roaring<s%> of a <S%H3715>lion<s%>; but his <S%H7522>favour<s%> is as <S%H2919>dew<s%> upon the <S%H6212>grass<s%>.

A <S%H3684>foolish<s%> <S%H1121>son<s%> is the <S%H1942>calamity<s%> of his <S%H1>father<s%>: and the <S%H4079>contentions<s%> of a <S%H802>wife<s%> are a <S%H2956>continual<s%> <S%H1812>dropping<s%>.
<S%H1004>House<s%> and <S%H1952>riches<s%> are the <S%H5159>inheritance<s%> of <S%H1>fathers<s%>: and a <S%H7919>prudent<s%> <S%H802>wife<s%> is from the <S%H3068>LORD<s%>.
<S%H6103>Slothfulness<s%> <S%H5307>casteth<s%> into a deep <S%H8639>sleep<s%>; and an <S%H7423>idle<s%> <S%H5315>soul<s%> shall suffer <S%H7456>hunger<s%>.
He that <S%H8104>keepeth<s%> the <S%H4687>commandment<s%> <S%H8104>keepeth<s%> his own <S%H5315>soul<s%>; but he that <S%H959>despiseth<s%> his <S%H1870>ways<s%> shall <S%H4191>die<s%>.

He that hath <S%H2603>pity<s%> upon the <S%H1800>poor<s%> <S%H3867>lendeth<s%> unto the <S%H3068>LORD<s%>; and that which he hath <S%H1576>given<s%> will he pay him <S%H7999>again<s%>. that which: or, his deed

<S%H3256>Chasten<s%> thy <S%H1121>son<s%> while there <S%H3426>is<s%> <S%H8615>hope<s%>, and let not thy <S%H5315>soul<s%> <S%H5375>spare<s%> for his <S%H4191>crying<s%>. for: or, to his destruction: or, to cause him to die

A <S%H1419>man<s%> of <S%H1632>great<s%> <S%H2534>wrath<s%> shall <S%H5375>suffer<s%> <S%H6066>punishment<s%>: for if thou <S%H5337>deliver<s%> him, yet thou must do it <S%H3254>again<s%>. do: Heb. add
<S%H8085>Hear<s%> <S%H6098>counsel<s%>, and <S%H6901>receive<s%> <S%H4148>instruction<s%>, that thou mayest be <S%H2449>wise<s%> in thy latter <S%H319>end<s%>.
There are <S%H7227>many<s%> <S%H4284>devices<s%> in a <S%H376>man's<s%> <S%H3820>heart<s%>; nevertheless the <S%H6098>counsel<s%> of the <S%H3068>LORD<s%>, that shall <S%H6965>stand<s%>.
The <S%H8378>desire<s%> of a <S%H120>man<s%> is his <S%H2617>kindness<s%>: and a poor <S%H7326>man<s%> is <S%H2896>better<s%> <S%H376>than<s%> a <S%H3577>liar<s%>.

The <S%H3374>fear<s%> of the <S%H3068>LORD<s%> tendeth to <S%H2416>life<s%>: and he that hath it shall <S%H3885>abide<s%> <S%H7649>satisfied<s%>; he shall not be <S%H6485>visited<s%> with <S%H7451>evil<s%>.
A <S%H6102>slothful<s%> man <S%H2934>hideth<s%> his <S%H3027>hand<s%> in his <S%H6747>bosom<s%>, and will not so much as <S%H7725>bring<s%> it to his <S%H6310>mouth<s%> <S%H7725>again<s%>.

<S%H5221>Smite<s%> a <S%H3887>scorner<s%>, and the <S%H6612>simple<s%> will <S%H6191>beware<s%>: and <S%H3198>reprove<s%> one that hath <S%H995>understanding<s%>, and he will <S%H995>understand<s%> <S%H1847>knowledge<s%>. will beware: Heb. will be cunning
He that <S%H7703>wasteth<s%> his <S%H1>father<s%>, and chaseth <S%H1272>away<s%> his <S%H517>mother<s%>, is a <S%H1121>son<s%> that causeth <S%H954>shame<s%>, and bringeth <S%H2659>reproach<s%>.
<S%H2308>Cease<s%>, my <S%H1121>son<s%>, to <S%H8085>hear<s%> the <S%H4148>instruction<s%> that causeth to <S%H7686>err<s%> from the <S%H561>words<s%> of <S%H1847>knowledge<s%>.

An <S%H1100>ungodly<s%> <S%H5707>witness<s%> <S%H3887>scorneth<s%> <S%H4941>judgment<s%>: and the <S%H6310>mouth<s%> of the <S%H7563>wicked<s%> <S%H1104>devoureth<s%> <S%H205>iniquity<s%>. An: Heb. A witness of Belial
<S%H8201>Judgments<s%> are <S%H3559>prepared<s%> for <S%H3887>scorners<s%>, and <S%H4112>stripes<s%> for the <S%H1460>back<s%> of <S%H3684>fools<s%>.
